questions.question: Your generator refuses to start after sitting for months. What’s the very first thing you check?
choices: The color of the spark plug
What brand of battery it has

questions.question: You’ve got river water that looks like chocolate milk. Fastest reliable way to make it drinkable?
choices: Boil it hard for at least 1 minute
Stir in some sand and wait

questions.question: Your metal fuel tank has a pinhole leak. Best wasteland patch that actually holds pressure?
Snapped a rear axle on your truck in the middle of nowhere. Minimum tools needed to limp it home?
choices: Floor jack, lug wrench, and spare parts

questions.question: You need a working water filter with only scavenged junk. Best layered materials?
choices: Gravel, sand, and charcoal (from a fire)

questions.question: Grid’s been down for years. How do you recharge 12V lead-acid batteries without a running generator?
choices: Literally all of the above work

questions.question: You’re sleeping in an uninsulated metal shack during winter. Best scavenged insulation that actually works?
choices: Mylar emergency blankets layered inside walls

questions.question: You crack open a dead desktop PC after the collapse. Which part is pure gold for a survivor?
Monsoon just hit and you need drinking water NOW. Quickest collection method?
choices: Stretch a tarp or poncho with a rock in the center to funnel
Build a mini dam in a creek
Just hold a bucket in the river

questions.question: Your shelter roof is leaking like a sieve during a storm. Fastest effective patch?
choices: Tarp over the top and tie it down tight
Nail scrap plywood over the holes

questions.question: You need to drill holes but power tools are long dead. Best hand-powered option?
No electricity, but you still need to keep food from spoiling in summer. Old-school refrigeration hack?
choices: Bury it 3–4 ft underground (or use a zeer pot)
Put it in a wooden box and pray
Cook it in a solar oven (that’s the opposite)

questions.question: Your only shelter is a metal shipping container cooking you alive. Best way to drop the interior temp fast?
choices: Hang wet blankets/cloth over the walls and roof
Heat it up more to “burn off” the heat

questions.question: You’re crossing hundreds of miles of wasteland. What’s the one repair kit you NEVER leave without?
choices: Duct tape, baling wire, vise-grips, and a multi-tool
500 ft of paracord and sidewalk chalk

questions.question: Your only radio just went silent. 9 times out of 10, what died first?
You’re reinforcing a settlement wall with whatever you can find. Strongest method without welding gear?
choices: Lash logs/poles with rope or wire

questions.question: You’ve got a pile of bedsheets but need strong rope yesterday. Best knot to join them end-to-end?
No matches, no lighter fluid left. Absolute fastest fire from common scavenged items?
choices: Flint and steel (if you have it)

questions.question: Your only solar panel took a rock and cracked. It still puts out power. Best field fix?
choices: Clear epoxy or glass glue to seal it

questions.question: Every real tool is broken or lost. You still need a weapon that can crack skulls. Best improvised option?
choices: Hammer head lashed to a sturdy branch

score.high: Wasteland Engineer Legend  You don’t just survive the apocalypse—you rebuild it.
score.medium: Solid Scrapper  You’ll live… probably. Keep duct tape close.
score.low: Future Raider Bait  Better hope someone tougher likes you.
